thread.title: Irving and James power Cavs past Thunder | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Irving and James power Cavs past Thunder | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Irving and James power Cavs past Thunder | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 8:51pm EST January 29, 2017 6:53pm EST Westbrook posts 24th triple-double. NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 29, 2017 
LeBron James and Kyrie Irving powered the Cleveland Cavaliers to a much-needed 107-91 win over the OKlahoma City Thunder. 
MORE: NBA players potentially affected by Trump's new immigration order 
Irving was at his dazzling best, finishing with 29 points and 10 assists, while James added 25 points, 14 rebounds and eight assists. 
Russell Westbrook and Irving went back and forth all game, with the OKC point guard tallying 20 points, 12 rebounds and 10 assists for his 24th triple-double of the season, but it wasn't enough. 
OKC kept things close through the first two quarters, but struggled when Westbrook went to the bench. They rallied late in the second quarter to tie things up just before the half at 43-43, but the Cavs then went on a 15-2 run to take a commanding 58-45 lead at the main break. 
Both teams traded blows in the third quarter, but the Cavs had too much offensive firepower, eventually stretching their lead to 19 points. 
Kyrie Irving was feelin' some type of way, showing off every dribble move in the book as he attacked the Thunder guards off the dribble with an array of playground moves. Uncle Drew is that you? Kyrie's out here dancing on the Thunder pic.twitter.com/BJCU0sRxWe â€” NBA Australia (@NBA_AU) January 29, 2017 
Kevin Love did not play in the second half, leaving the game with back spasms. 
OKC stuggled to get clean looks at the basket all night, shooting a miserable 37% from the field. Westbrook himself shot just 7-for 26 on the night, while Victor Oladpo's 17 points came on 6-for-18. 
After dropping six of their past eight, the Cavs have now won back-to-back games, easing the pressure that was bulding around the organisation. 
They look to continue their run as they travel to Dallas ot take on the Mavs on Wednesday AEDT, while the Thunder prepare to take on the Spurs on Thursday.
